clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy Study of a Low Volume of Water Intake and Mosapride for Endoscopy in Patients With Subtotal Gastrectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of a Low Volume of Water Intake and Mosapride for Endoscopy Preparation in Gastric Cancer Patients With Subtotal Gastrectomy: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: A low volume of water intake and mosapride will effectively reduce food residue in remnant stomach for patients who had undergone subtotal gastrectomy due to gastric cancer.

detailed_description.textblock: We evaluate that a 500mL of water intake and mosapride will effectively reduce food residue in remnant stomach for patients who had undergone subtotal gastrectomy due to gastric cancer. We plan to compare this method with routine midnight fasting method for endoscopy in patients with subtotal gastrectomy.

primary_outcome.measure: Degrees of food residue using endoscopic scoring system
primary_outcome.description: We plan to evaluate how much a low volume of water and mosapride, compared with routine fasting, reduse food residue in gastric remnant for endoscopy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Tolerability of a low volume of water and mosapride
secondary_outcome.description: We plan to evaluate tolerability of a low volume of water and mosapride compared with routine fasting for endoscopy preparation in patients with subtotal gastrectomy

clinical_study.condition: Foreign Body Left During Endoscopic Examination

arm_group.description: The patients in this group will have midnight fasting the day before endoscopic examination
The patients in this group will take mosapride and a 500mL water at evening of the day before endoscopic examination.

intervention.description: Mosapride 10mg, one dosage, once evening of the day before the endoscopy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Outpatients who had subtotal gastrectomy for gastric cancer
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Lactation
- History of anastomotic stricture
- Recurrent advanced gastric cancer
- Poor general condition( > 2 ECOG)
- Other disseminated malignancy
- Significant renal failure or congestive heart failure (CHF)
- Liver failure
